alert.note: Alert for Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 5:53PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Orange, central Addison, northwestern Windsor and southwestern Washington Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 553 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Salisbury, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Middlebury, Braintree Hill, Northfield Village, Hancock, Salisbury, Warren, Ripton, Northfield, Randolph, Roxbury, Leicester, Braintree, Granville, Goshen, Brookfield, Rochester, Lincoln, Cornwall, Weybridge, and Bethel. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 28 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
